snippet: Fabio Luisi, the Metropolitan Opera’s principal conductor during James Levine’s medical leave, said the Met might not be able to count on him if Mr. Levine’s comeback does not go as planned.
abstract: Fabio Luisi, who has been principal conductor of the Metropolitan Opera Orchestra while James Levine recovers from back surgery, may not be available to fill in if Levine's return for the 2013-14 season has complications.
lead_paragraph: Fabio Luisi, the Metropolitan Opera’s principal conductor during James Levine’s medical leave, said the Met might not be able to count on him if Mr. Levine’s comeback does not go as planned.

headline.seo: Fabio Luisi Can’t Cover for James Levine in Next Met Season
headline.main: The Met’s Pinch Hitter Can’t Always Step Up
headline.print_headline: The Met’s Pinch Hitter Can’t Always Step Up
